page.title: 08 FARMING - NORSTED MANOR
page.content: {Norsted Manor} was mentioned in the original Domesday Book in 1086. It is a small manor house in the Cudham Parish. It is a large farm of 850 acres with 400 acres used for growing wheat and barley and the remaining 450 acres used for grazing. The farm has a flock of 350 sheep and a herd of 150 beef cattle. Animals are usually sent to market in Sevenoaks. Farm workers live on the estate in farm cottages. There is quite a lot of {Broad-leaved Woodland} still standing on the estate and many of the trees are protected from felling by {preservation orders} placed by the London Borough of Bromley as a conservation measure. Norted Manor was the country home of the {Lord Mayor of London} until about 200 years ago.
